summary: Once upon a time, in a far away swamp, there lived an ogre named Shrek (Mike Myers) whose precious solitude is suddenly shattered by an invasion of annoying fairy tale characters. They were all banished from their kingdom by the evil Lord Farquaad (John Lithgow). Determined to save their home -- not to mention his -- Shrek cuts a deal with Farquaad and sets out to rescue Princess Fiona (Cameron Diaz) to be Farquaad's bride. Rescuing the Princess may be small compared to her deep, dark secret.

reviews.content: You can just watch and watch this movie and it's still great every time 10/10

Shrek is a delightful animated movie that has captured the hearts of audiences of all ages. The movie's unique blend of humor, heart, and adventure is a true testament to the power of storytelling. The film's characters are lovable and memorable, with Shrek himself being an endearing and relatable protagonist. The animation is top-notch, with vibrant colors and attention to detail that truly bring the fairy tale world to life. Overall, Shrek is a classic movie that will continue to entertain and inspire audiences for years to come.

For me this will just never live up to that top tier of animated classics. It comes very close, and I understand why some people will put it there, but for me it just fall slightly short. The voice acting and animation are great. The story is pretty good. But the overall package just doesn't come together and present that magic reaction you would hope for when adding all those elements together. Don't get me wrong, I love this movie. It's far from being bad, I've seen it tons of times, and I'll probably watch it a few more as well. But it's just not one that I want to watch over and over. 7.75/10

I've watched a ton of horror movies throughout my life and I honestly don't understand why this one has gotten such terrible reviews...There were a few moments that were a little laughable and the character development could have been fleshed out a bit more, but overall I think it was one of the better horror flicks I've seen to date. This movie is WAY underrated in my opinion. In fact, when you actually dig a little further into all the symbolism, lore and subtleties behind it, I think it's kind of brilliant! Especially if you're familiar with Dante's Inferno. Definitely recommend you ignore the Critics score on this one - if you're looking for something that combines mystery and adventure with creepy suspense and a fear of small spaces, this one's a gem!

I liked this as a kid but love it as an adult and I'm glad that I rewatched it. The satirical and humor and sarcasm, the voice acting, the originality, the choice of music, the simplicity, the message it sends, it's all fantastic! It's a love story, a comedy, and skilled animation all put into one masterful film! This is one of the all time masterpieces from Dreamworks and I say that very confidently! And to top it all off, it's only an hour and a half long, however you wish it was longer! This is one of the most likable movies that there can be!

Shrek
⭐7.9/10▪︎🟦84%▪︎763.564▪︎6+▪︎2001▪︎Animation / Adventure / Fantasy / Comedy / Family
⭐9.2/10▪︎🟦94%▪︎OBLIT▪︎6+▪︎2001▪︎Animation / Adventure / Fantasy / Comedy / Family

I liked the incidental music very much, especially in the escape from the Dragon scene. I wasn't hugely fond of the pop music featured, but putting that minor quibble aside, this was still an original and funny animated film, that will please any animation lover. The animation is faultless, never stiff, and lovely backgrounds. The script is laugh-out-loud funny with the fairytale characters, Gingerbread Man especially, and Robin Hood. The characters are definitely memorable, and the terrific voice cast brings the film to life. Mike Myers voices the ogre with feeling, but it is Eddie Murphy who steals the film. Though Cameron Diaz is lovely as Fiona, and John Lithgow is delightfully villainous as Lord Farquad, though his villain isn't the most memorable villain ever in an animation. The film sparkles with heart and humour, it is impossible not to like it. In conclusion, look out for it, you'll be glad you did! 9/10 Bethany Cox.

I honestly don't get why people pretend like this movie is a cinematic masterpiece. The story had potential, but it's completely ruined by the movie trying desperately to be funny. I didn't laugh once at any of the jokes the movie tried to make, and the fact that the movie was trying desperately to be funny didn't help either. The humor, as far as you can even call it that, is about as witty as Rick and Morty - a show that, despite the copypasta about needing a high IQ to fully understand it, relies mostly on shock humor - but fails entirely to make even a single one of the jokes land.
An instant classic, this one.

This movie changed my life thoroughly, for the better. It taught me the layers of people living their lives, in a way comparable to an onion. It made me want to wake up to make waffles, instead of staying in my bed. This is the best movie I have ever seen, and I highly recommend it if you need some changing of your life to be done as well.

The jokes are so well done and there is so much originality to one of the oldest plots there is in storytelling. The Message of the movie is timeless as well. In a time when Hollywood was pumping more bad quality films than good ones this one stands out as a true all time classic animated film and in General one of the best as well.
Shrek is not only well animated, but with its strong performances from its cast and a fun story and narrative that is bound to keep everyone entertained for everyone to watch.

I liked the incidental music very much, especially in the escape from the Dragon scene. I wasn't hugely fond of the pop music featured, but putting that minor quibble aside, this was still an original and funny animated film, that will please any animation lover. The animation is faultless, never stiff, and lovely backgrounds. The script is laugh-out-loud funny with the fairytale characters, Gingerbread Man especially, and Robin Hood. The characters are definitely memorable, and the terrific voice cast brings the film to life. Mike Myers voices the ogre with feeling, but it is Eddie Murphy who steals the film. Though Cameron Diaz is lovely as Fiona, and John Lithgow is delightfully villainous as Lord Farquad, though his villain isn't the most memorable villain ever in an animation. The film sparkles with heart and humour, it is impossible not to like it. In conclusion, look out for it, you'll be glad you did! 9/10 Bethany Cox.

Shrek is a DreamWorks animated feature film directed by Andrew Adamson and Vicki Jenson, released on 18 May 2001, about an unsociable ogre named Shrek. The cartoon is based on William Steig's work "Shrek!".

The plot is both gripping and touching. An ogre named Shrek lives in a house in a swamp. Because of a conflict with Lord Farquaad, his house is taken away. At the same time Shrek rescues a talking donkey, which was about to be sold at the market of magical animals. Shrek and Donkey have to go to the dragon's tower to rescue the beautiful princess Farquaad secretly hopes to marry.  Normally when it comes to fairy-tale stories, like a prince rescuing a princess, in this version, Shrek the ogre  rescues a princess.

Shrek is great, his sarcasm makes you laugh to death.Donkey is an incredibly hilarious character, for which you could rewatch this film hundreds of times. Princess Fiona is powerful and independent, and she breaks every princess canon.

At the end, I'd like to say that the script is original, and the catchy soundtrack is also worth noting. You can' t beat unwinding while watching Shrek and having a good laugh.
This movie is so amazing. The cast of characters in the movie is so great and talented. I defiantly recommended this to everyone, especially kids.

When I was a kid, I usually watching movie about the green and terrible ogre Shrek. At the age of 4, I laughed at his jokes, although I didn't understand them, his lifestyle, and especially at his not very smart friend Donkey. Besides, I don't know why, but Shrek always reminded me of my dad. He has the same charisma, similar jokes, offensive, but at the same time funny.
And just recently, at the age of 18, I reviewed all the parts of Shrek, and realized that this isn't a simple children's cartoon with jokes that only adults understand, but also a cartoon with a deep subtext. For all 4 parts, you can see how the evil green giant turned into a kind, cheerful friend, husband and father. Having met his love, Fiona, he changed. In each following part, he did everything to make Fiona happy.
This is a wonderful cartoon to watch with the whole family.

This is one of the first animated films that I watched, I was very impressed after watching it. If you haven't watched it, then the main character of the cartoon is a big and scary ogre, who was forced to perform a feat. He has to rescue the princess from the tower under the dragon guard. Shrek is a comedy for the whole family, adults will be able to laugh with secret jokes, and children with everyone else. Storyline is fast and dynamic. There are also a lot of cool songs in the cartoon, from rock to pop. Shrek still looks very modern and relevant, I recommend everyone to watch this cartoon
One of the best movies of all time. Has something for everyone and very very quotable. I loved it as a kid and enjoy it still as much as an adult.

Shrek really was one of the greatest and worst things to ever happen for animated kids' movies. While about eight thousand films tried to replicate it in the years to come of the early aughts which may have created cynicism and reactionary fatigue directed toward the Shrek franchise as a whole, it cannot be overstated how revolutionary of a product the original Shrek movie was. Revisiting it some 20 years later, the first two thirds are a hilarious and scathing parody of the Disney animated films of the '90s. I applaud Dreamworks for creating such a well-crafted parody that I understood perfectly as an adult (how did anyone hear the name "Lord Farquaad" and think this was a film for kids?).

That being said-even if you don't understand the historical context it was released in and have intimate knowledge of the films it parodies-Shrek is a compelling narrative in its own right. While I do think in the last third of the film it sort of becomes the kind of film it seeks to parody, there is no denying the movie created a compelling set of characters and emotional beats able to stand toe-to-toe with the best of Disney. I don't really love gross out humor all that much (never loved it as a kid, either), but Shrek is a fun movie. Solid 7/10 for me.
enjoyable good plot weird villian amazing animation funny 10/10
I like seeing this movie brought back as a flashback. This is the second time I saw this movie at a theater.

Based on a character by William Steig, Shrek is an ogre living in isolation in the middle of his forest. Suddenly a bunch of characters from various fairy tales enter and displease him. It turns out a king has ejected them from his realm, and Shrek goes to confront the king, whose daughter has gone missing. Shrek and the king made a deal to find the daughter and send the exiled beings somewhere else.

This original version, unlike the sequels, features vulgar and scatological humor, and probably was not necessarily meant for small children. Nor is it emotionally involving like the better animated movies are. Passable, but not necessarily suited for family viewing.

You get the right amount of humor language and heart to create a comedy with big stars to back it up.  Shrek knows how to keep kids entertained and adults laughing their socks off with jokes that kids won't understand.

I personally loved it. It was a nice entertaining movie and all the actors did their part. I also loved the relatable friendship between Shreck and the donkey.

One of my favorite animated movies ever. Five stars!

One of the funniest animated movies that I have seen in my entire life if not the funniest, can't think of any other that's been funnier and entertaining. I loved it.
Shrek is just... Perfect for me. It has everything I could need for a movie. But... Shrek 2 still better
One of my favorite non-Disney animated features ever, Shrek remains a funny fantasy classic after 20 years of its release.

This movie is a marvelous fairly tale with a thrilling quest and a happily ever after ending.  Shrek has the great themes of enduring myths, about believing in yourself, being loved for who you are, and good triumphing over evil.  It's also great satire, tweaking assumptions about ogres, princesses, rescues, and even fire breathing dragons.  Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, and John Lithgow are all perfect in their roles.

The computer animation is breathtaking for its time, like nothing seen before it.  The textures are stunning.  The glass, fire, clouds, and water seem 3-D.  The animation has wonderful warmth an depth but it also has great character and wit.  The facial expressions and body language are are a real treat.
so this it legit the best move ever
